syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 1
syllabus.description: Early mathematics curriculum focusing on number recognition, counting, basic addition and subtraction, and shapes.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 1
syllabus.description: Early literacy skills including phonics, reading simple texts, basic writing, and speaking and listening.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 1
syllabus.description: Introduction to basic scientific concepts including plants, animals, materials, and seasonal changes.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 2
syllabus.description: Developing number skills, addition and subtraction within 100, multiplication and division concepts, and measurement.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 2
syllabus.description: Building on literacy skills, reading more complex texts, developing writing fluency, grammar, and punctuation.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 2
syllabus.description: Exploring living things, habitats, uses of materials, and basic physics concepts like forces.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 3
syllabus.description: Extending number and place value, formal methods of addition and subtraction, multiplication tables, and fractions.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 3
syllabus.description: Developing reading comprehension, writing different text types, improving grammar and vocabulary.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 3
syllabus.description: Focusing on plants, animals including humans, rocks, light, and forces and magnets.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 4
syllabus.description: Larger numbers, multiplication and division, fractions and decimals, measurement, and geometry.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 4
syllabus.description: Reading a wider range of texts, planning and writing longer pieces, and using accurate grammar and punctuation.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 4
syllabus.description: Exploring living things and their habitats, states of matter, electricity, and sound.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 5
syllabus.description: Number to a million, decimals, percentages, fractions, area and perimeter, and properties of shapes.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 5
syllabus.description: Reading and analyzing various text types, writing with detail and structure, and understanding complex grammar.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 5
syllabus.description: Focusing on living things, life cycles, properties and changes of materials, forces, and Earth and space.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 6
syllabus.description: Extending number skills, algebra basics, ratio and proportion, statistics, and more complex geometry.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 6
syllabus.description: Advanced reading comprehension, sophisticated writing techniques, and secure understanding of grammar and punctuation.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 6
syllabus.description: In-depth study of living things, evolution and inheritance, light, electricity, and the human body.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 7
syllabus.description: Introduction to secondary mathematics, including number systems, algebra, geometry, and statistics.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 7
syllabus.description: Developing critical reading skills, exploring different genres of writing, and enhancing language analysis.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 7
syllabus.description: Foundational concepts in biology, chemistry, and physics, including cells, matter, and energy.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 8
syllabus.description: Extending algebraic manipulation, geometric reasoning, data handling, and problem-solving skills.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 8
syllabus.description: Analyzing complex texts, developing persuasive writing, and understanding literary techniques.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 8
syllabus.description: Building on scientific knowledge in biology, chemistry, and physics with more detailed concepts.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics Year 9
syllabus.description: Preparing for GCSE, covering advanced algebra, geometry, trigonometry, and statistics.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Year 9
syllabus.description: Developing sophisticated analytical and writing skills in preparation for GCSE English Language and Literature.
syllabus.subject: English

syllabus.title: Science Year 9
syllabus.description: Consolidating scientific understanding and introducing more advanced topics as a foundation for GCSE science.
syllabus.subject: Science

syllabus.title: Mathematics GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE Mathematics curriculum covering number, algebra, ratio, proportion, geometry, statistics, and probability.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: English Language GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE English Language specification focusing on reading comprehension, writing skills, and spoken language.
syllabus.subject: English Language

syllabus.title: English Literature GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE English Literature specification covering the study of poetry, prose, and drama.
syllabus.subject: English Literature

syllabus.title: Biology GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE Biology specification covering cell biology, organisation, infection and response, and more.
syllabus.subject: Biology

syllabus.title: Chemistry GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE Chemistry specification including atomic structure, bonding, quantitative chemistry, and more.
syllabus.subject: Chemistry

syllabus.title: Physics GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE Physics specification covering energy, electricity, magnetism, waves, and more.
syllabus.subject: Physics

syllabus.title: History GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE History specification covering various historical periods and topics.
syllabus.subject: History

syllabus.title: Geography GCSE
syllabus.description: GCSE Geography specification including physical and human geography topics.
syllabus.subject: Geography

syllabus.title: Mathematics A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level Mathematics specification including pure maths, mechanics, and statistics.
syllabus.subject: Maths

syllabus.title: Further Mathematics A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level Further Mathematics specification building on core maths with advanced topics.
syllabus.subject: Further Maths

syllabus.title: Biology A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level Biology specification covering biological molecules, cells, genetics, ecology, and more.
syllabus.subject: Biology

syllabus.title: Chemistry A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level Chemistry specification including physical, inorganic, and organic chemistry.
syllabus.subject: Chemistry

syllabus.title: Physics A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level Physics specification covering mechanics, electricity, fields, waves, nuclear physics, and more.
syllabus.subject: Physics

syllabus.title: English Literature A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level English Literature specification involving the study of a range of literary texts.
syllabus.subject: English Literature

syllabus.title: History A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level History specification covering different historical periods and themes in depth.
syllabus.subject: History

syllabus.title: Geography A-Level
syllabus.description: A-Level Geography specification exploring physical and human geographical processes and interactions.
syllabus.subject: Geography

syllabus.title: Key Stage 1
syllabus.description: Curriculum for Key Stage 1 (Years 1 and 2) focusing on foundational skills in core subjects.
syllabus.subject: All Subjects

syllabus.title: Key Stage 2
syllabus.description: Curriculum for Key Stage 2 (Years 3 to 6) building on KS1 with more complex topics.
syllabus.subject: All Subjects

syllabus.title: Key Stage 3
syllabus.description: Curriculum for Key Stage 3 (Years 7 to 9) preparing students for GCSEs.
syllabus.subject: All Subjects

syllabus.title: Key Stage 4
syllabus.description: Curriculum for Key Stage 4 (Years 10 and 11) covering GCSE subjects.
syllabus.subject: GCSE Subjects

syllabus.title: Key Stage 5
syllabus.description: Curriculum for Key Stage 5 (Years 12 and 13) covering A-Level subjects.
syllabus.subject: A-Level Subjects

syllabus.title: IGCSE
syllabus.description: International General Certificate of Secondary Education across various subjects.
syllabus.subject: Various

syllabus.title: GCSE
syllabus.description: General Certificate of Secondary Education across a wide range of subjects.
syllabus.subject: Various

syllabus.title: A-Levels
syllabus.description: Advanced Level qualifications in various subjects for post-16 education.
syllabus.subject: Various

syllabus.title: 11 Plus
syllabus.description: Entrance examination for selective secondary schools, covering verbal reasoning, non-verbal reasoning, maths, and English.
syllabus.subject: Verbal Reasoning/Non-Verbal Reasoning/Maths/English

syllabus.title: SATs (Year 6)
syllabus.description: Standard Assessment Tests for Year 6 in English and Mathematics.
syllabus.subject: English/Maths

syllabus.title: International Baccalaureate (IB)
syllabus.description: A comprehensive two-year pre-university qualification covering six subject groups and the core components (EE, TOK, CAS).
syllabus.subject: Various (Language and Literature, Language Acquisition, Individuals and Societies, Sciences, Mathematics, Arts)

syllabus.title: IB Middle Years Programme
syllabus.description: A five-year programme for students aged 11-16, providing a framework of learning that emphasizes intellectual challenge and making connections between subjects.
syllabus.subject: Various (Language and Literature, Language Acquisition, Individuals and Societies, Sciences, Mathematics, Arts, Physical and Health Education, Design)

syllabus.title: IB Primary Years Programme
syllabus.description: A curriculum framework for children aged 3-12, focusing on inquiry-based learning and the development of the whole child.
syllabus.subject: Transdisciplinary (Language, Mathematics, Social Studies, Science, Arts, Physical, Social and Personal Education)
